intro: Monticalia guadalupe, commonly known as Guadalupe's monticalia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
